On Fri, 16 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> OK. You're using "kludge" in the clinical sense. The word has emotional
> overtones for me, so that's what I reacted to. I understand better now
> what you meant, and no harm done.

Ah, good. I'm glad you understand. I certainly meant no harm.

> > I kludge things all the time because the
> > downside of the kludge is less than the cost to "do it right."
>
> I think this is a case where you don't know yet how to "do it right".

You betcha! That's why I posted in the first place.

> I suggest filtering the test results until you have a few different
> instances of such dependencies, from which you can get a better sense
> of how you'd "do it right".

I've got plenty of instances of such dependencies; I've just not found
a way to describe them that struck me as nice, small and neat.

cjs
